page.title: 09JOINT MITNOR CAVE
page.content: even to photograph them.The caves that we saw were in an old quarry.Along the path were dead trees which{Mr Joint said were to encourage more wildlife in to the Quarry.Already there are moles,shrews and ants and many more birds coming back into the quarry.{ {Joint Mitnor}was our next stop and inside was a bone desposit which is unique.It is the only cave in{Europe in which these very important deposits have been left in the{talus}formation so that you can see the bones and skeletons.We saw the tooth of a baby {straight-toothed elephant}which was the size of a cucumber.After{Joint {Mitnor}we went along a path and into the museum to see some primitive tools and skeletons found in the caves.
